SEARCH
Package com.example.demo.controller

Class ChatController

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.controller.ChatController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/chat") public class ChatController extends Object
This is RestController. It processes related requests with Chat. The @RestController process incoming HTTP requests and return data in JSON or XML format. The @RequestMapping("/api/chat") all controller methods will process requests along the path "/api/chat". The @RequiredArgsConstructor provided by the Lombok project to automatically generate a constructor that takes arguments for all final fields of a class and automatically initializes those fields when an instance of the class is created. The @Slf4j provided by the Lombok project to automatically generate logging methods in a class.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Andrey Sharipov

  • Method Details

    • getChat

      @GetMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getChat(@PathVariable("id") String id)
      Controller method for GET requests to "/api/chat/{id}" which takes an id from url and returns a ResponseEntity with an HttpStatus.OK and a ChatResponse class object in the response body.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID taken from the URL "/api/chat/{id}", where {id} is a variable.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the retrieved Chat response object with status HttpStatus.OK, if the Chat with the specified ID is found. Otherwise, an ExceptionResponse with a HttpStatus.NOT_FOUND status.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the Chat is not found by id.
      See Also:
      • ChatResponse
      • ExceptionResponse

    • createChat

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> createChat(@RequestBody ChatRequest request, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
      The controller method receives a POST request to create a chat and sets the user passed to Authentication as an admin. The body of the request contains ChatRequest.
      Parameters:
      request - ChatRequest.
      auth - An Authentication object containing User authentication information.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity object containing UUIDResponse which contains the id of the created chat with status HttpStatus.OK. In other cases, ResponseEntity with ExceptionResponse in the response body, with status HttpStatus.CONFLICT.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if saving the Chat to the database failed.
      IllegalStateException - if the User does not exist in the database.
      NullPointerException - if the User is not authenticated.
      See Also:
      • ChatRequest
      • Chat
      • UUIDResponse
      • ExceptionResponse

    • deleteChat

      @DeleteMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteChat(@RequestBody ChatRequest request, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
      Controller method that deletes Chat.
      Parameters:
      request - ChatRequest.
      auth - An Authentication object containing User authentication information.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with status HttpStatus.OK. In other cases, ResponseEntity with ExceptionResponse in the response body, with status HttpStatus.FORBIDDEN.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if deleting the Chat of the database failed.
      IllegalStateException - if the User does not exist in the database.
      NullPointerException - if the User is not authenticated.
      See Also:
      • ChatRequest
      • ExceptionResponse

    • updateChat

      @PutMapping("/edit") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateChat(@RequestBody ChatRequest request, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
      Controller method for Chat update.
      Parameters:
      request - ChatRequest.
      auth - An Authentication object containing User authentication information.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with status HttpStatus.OK. In other cases, ResponseEntity with ExceptionResponse in the response body, with status HttpStatus.FORBIDDEN.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if saving the Chat to the database failed.
      IllegalStateException - if the User does not exist in the database.
      NullPointerException - if the User is not authenticated.
      See Also:
      • ChatRequest
      • ExceptionResponse

    • addRoleToUser

      @PutMapping("/role") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addRoleToUser(@RequestBody ChatRoleRequest request, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
      Controller method for assigning a Role to a User in a Chat.
      Parameters:
      request - ChatRoleRequest.
      auth - An Authentication object containing User authentication information.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with status HttpStatus.OK. In other cases, ResponseEntity with ExceptionResponse in the response body, with status HttpStatus.FORBIDDEN.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if saving the Chat to the database failed.
      IllegalStateException - if the User or Chat does not exist in the database.
      NullPointerException - if the User is not authenticated.
      See Also:
      • ChatRoleRequest
      • ExceptionResponse

    • addUser

      @PutMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addUser(@RequestBody ChatUserRequest request, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
      A controller method that adds a User to the Chat and assigns a Role.ROLE_USER to him.
      Parameters:
      request - ChatUserRequest.
      auth - An Authentication object containing User authentication information.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with status HttpStatus.OK. In other cases, ResponseEntity with ExceptionResponse in the response body, with status HttpStatus.FORBIDDEN.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if saving the Chat to the database failed.
      IllegalStateException - if the User or Chat does not exist in the database.
      NullPointerException - if the User is not authenticated.
      See Also:
      • ChatUserRequest
      • ExceptionResponse

    • removeUser

      @DeleteMapping("/user") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> removeUser(@RequestBody ChatUserRequest request, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
      A controller method that removes a User from a Chat.
      Parameters:
      request - ChatUserRequest.
      auth - An Authentication object containing User authentication information.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with status HttpStatus.OK. In other cases, ResponseEntity with ExceptionResponse in the response body, with status HttpStatus.FORBIDDEN.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if saving the Chat to the database failed.
      IllegalStateException - if the User or Chat does not exist in the database.
      NullPointerException - if the User is not authenticated.
      See Also:
      • ChatUserRequest
      • ExceptionResponse
